entry.title: SSAM Branded APP file ID's
entry.content:
Hi,

While branding the SSAM 2410, we only made changes to the MDKProject.JSON file. The released APK file has been installed on our mobile, and it is working fine. 

We have gone through one of the SAP blog, 

In the blog, it is mentioned that need to make changes in “BrandedSettings.Json” file as per the client details from “Mobile Services admin UI”

While Branding SSAM 2410 we didn’t do any changes in the BrandedSettings.Json file but still the branded application is working fine.

Do we need add all the highlighted lines in the BrandedSettings.Json file?

Does it impact the Branded SSAM 2410 App ?

Thanks.

 




------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: SSAM Branded APP file ID's
entry.content:
Hello,
Hope you are doing well.

For clarification, these json files will impact different behavior of your Application:
---
- BrandedSettings.json: Runtime configurations such as security settings, URLs for connecting to the SAP Business Technology Platform Mobile Services, and more
- MDKProject.json: Build time configurations such as the application name, version, and bundle ID
---
About your doubts, the App build should be working but the future user onboarding and other connection events should be verified: in case you are not planning to use SSAM client from the App Store, how will the onboarding for user be happening ?

Without and onboarding QR Code, you cuold be using BrandedSettings to define the connections to be used by default.
Nevertheless, the need for the QR Code is so the client knows where to connect in order to onboard to the correct application / identity provider.

In terms of options today, you can

1) Brand your own client that hardcodes the connection information. You can release your client to the public or private app stores for users to install

2) Have users copy and load an Overrides.json file to their device which contains the connection information. More steps than just scanning the QR code.

3) Provide an internal webpage for users to visit from their device with a link to click that contains the same information in the QR code. 

Last but not least, I suggest to follow up on the dedicated SSAM guide for branding: https://help.sap.com/docs/service-asset-manager/sap-service-and-asset-manager-installation-guide/building-sap-service-and-asset-manager-application-client?version=2410&locale=en-US  

Kind regards,
Douglas

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Mass creation of Business Roles and assignment to Bus...
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

In the 'Maintain Business Roles' app, it is possible to perform many actions regarding business roles management. Including the creation of new business roles and the assignment to multiple users at once.

The SAP Help Portal provides an extensive material for many scenarios and business requirements regarding business roles. In the following pages, you can find several guides on how to perform the creation of business roles:

  • Maintain Business Roles
  • How to Create a New Business Role
  • How to Download and Upload Business Roles
  • How to Import and Export Business Roles
  • How to Make Mass Changes to Business Roles

If any issues occur during the creation and assignment of business roles, create an incident under the BC-SRV-APS-IAM component.

Best regards,

SAP Support

entry.title: Re: How to Handle Multi-Country Assignments with Aggregat...
entry.content:
Hey @Xavier 🙂 Thank you soo much for your quick response 🙂


I have now tried out to change the following: (force100ForEntryIndivPercent="false") form "true" to "false" and it is actually reflecting the performance rating correctly regardless that chosen rule and the dates- not sure why it is working now but it is so no complains.

However what I mean with that the ratings together with guidelines are not working as expected is that I get only one common performance rating with one common guidelines. Meaning that - what is happening now is for example:

Employee has three assignments where the salary is unchangeable it is the same as of a fixed date and it is 603,384 SEK - Bonus equation basis x business x Individual

Assignment 1: 
Start date 01 Jan - End date 31 Jan 2025

VC target% -  12% 

Proration: 4%

Target Amount is: 2896 kr

Assignment 2:
Start date: 14 Jan 2025 - End date 26 Jun 2025

VC target% - 12%

Prpration: 45%

Target Amount: 32583 kr

Assignment 3:

Start date: 27 Jun 2025 - End date 31 Dec 2025

VC target % - 12%

Proration: 52%

Target Amount: 37651 kr

 

Currently, the system is summing up all the target amounts first and then applying each individual payout percentage to that total sum, which is 73,130 kr

But what my customer is expecting is that there is an individual contribution for each assignment and each will be multiplied by it's specifc target amount and it's specific Business performance perfect

So for instance - For the Swedish assignment where the target is 2896 kr - there is a specific business performance percent (we are using direct method here so it is a specific result percent that will be provided) which is 134% and the individual contribution here is 80%  - the total incentive payout for this one should be: 3105 kr

Then Spanish assignment where the target is 32583 kr - there is a specific business performance percent (we are using direct method here so it is a specific result percent that will be provided) which is 130% and the individual contribution here is 90%  - the total incentive payout for this one should be: 38122 kr

Then Spanish assignment where the target is 37651 kr - there is a specific business performance percent (we are using direct method here so it is a specific result percent that will be provided) which is 120% and the individual contribution here is 100%  - the total incentive payout for this one should be: 45181kr

 

And at the end the total payout for this employee would be: 86408kr

 

Does that make sense?

Regards,

entry.title: Re: SAP Fiori elements extension: upload Excel files to create new entries using building blocks
entry.content:
Hi @marcel_waechter,

Thank you for your reply.  

Q1: Did you follow the same steps as in the referenced blog and mine?

A1: I followed the same steps as the reference blog, and uploading with the FileUploader is working as expected (branch: FileUploader). The difference from your application is that your application is using a XML View whereas mine is using a fragment with a controller extension. 

Q2: Is the excel property edit enabled?

A2: I am not sure how to enable edit for the excel property. The entity definition is as follows:

using my.bookshop as my from '../db/schema';

service CatalogService {
    @readonly entity Books as projection on my.Books;

    @cds.persistence.skip
    @odata.singleton
    @odata.draft.enabled
    entity ExcelUpload {
        @Core.MediaType : 'application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml.sheet'
        excel: LargeBinary; 
        dummy: String; 
    }
}

Q3: Which UI5 version did you use?

A3: I used 1.136.1.

Q4: You can test it by adding any other property of your entity in the dialog, and see if it's shown readonly, or in edit mode. You might add another string or integer property into the singleton type, and try to render this one in the dialog. Does this work?

A4: I have added a dummy field to the singleton entity as shown above. It was rendered as read-only as well.

Fragment definition

<core:FragmentDefinition xmlns:core="sap.ui.core"
    xmlns="sap.m" 
    xmlns:macros="sap.fe.macros" >

    <Dialog 
        id="uploadDialog" 
        title="Upload Excel File" 
        contentWidth="500px" 
        contentHeight="300px"
        beforeOpen=".onBeforeOpen"
        afterClose=".onAfterClose"> 

    <content> 
        <macros:Field id="excelFile" metaPath="/ExcelUpload/excel" /> 
        <macros:Field id="dummy" metaPath="/ExcelUpload/dummy" /> 
    </content> 

    <beginButton> 
      <Button id="closeButton" text="Close" press=".closeDialog" /> 
    </beginButton> 

  </Dialog> 
    
</core:FragmentDefinition>

Controller extension

import ExtensionAPI from 'sap/fe/core/ExtensionAPI';
import Context from 'sap/ui/model/odata/v4/Context';
import Dialog, { Dialog$AfterCloseEvent, Dialog$BeforeOpenEvent } from 'sap/m/Dialog';
import ODataModel from 'sap/ui/model/odata/v4/ODataModel';

/**
 * Generated event handler.
 *
 * @param this reference to the 'this' that the event handler is bound to.
 * @param pageContext the context of the page on which the event was fired
 */
export function upload(this: ExtensionAPI, pageContext: Context) {
    this.loadFragment({
        id: "exelUploadDialog",
        name: "ns.books.ext.fragment.ExcelUploadDialog",
        controller: dialogController(this)
    }).then(dialog => {
        const model = this.getModel() as ODataModel;
        (dialog as Dialog).setModel(model);
        (dialog as Dialog).open();
    })
}

function dialogController(extensionAPI: ExtensionAPI) {
    let dialog: Dialog | undefined

    return {
        onBeforeOpen: function (evnet: Dialog$BeforeOpenEvent) {
            dialog = evnet.getSource() as Dialog;
            extensionAPI.addDependent(dialog);            
        },

        onAfterClose: function (event: Dialog$AfterCloseEvent) {
            if (dialog) {
                extensionAPI.removeDependent(dialog);
                dialog.destroy();
                dialog = undefined;
            }
        },

        closeDialog: function () {
            dialog?.close();
        }
    }
}

entry.title: JOINVILLE no SAP NOW AI Tour Brazil
entry.content:
O SAP NOW AI Tour Brazil vai ocorrer nos dias 19 e 20 de agosto de 2025, no Transamerica Expo Center, em São Paulo. Este evento é uma evolução significativa no conceito SAP NOW, com foco total na Inteligência Artificial integrada ao ERP e nuvem, reunindo líderes de grandes empresas, especialistas SAP e parceiros para discutir tendências, casos reais de IA, transformação digital, sustentabilidade e gestão empresarial.

Relevância do evento

  • Networking estratégico: CEOs, CIOs, tomadores de decisão e executivos de diversas funções (TI, RH, operações, finanças) vão se encontrar para trocar experiências e fechar parcerias .

  • Conteúdo de ponta: keynotes com Rui Botelho, Adriana Aroulho, Muhammad Alam e outros líderes, além de sessões paralelas com demos de IA generativa aplicada a ERP, cadeia de suprimentos, RH, customer experience etc.

  • Transformação real: demonstrações ao vivo, painéis inspiradores (com figuras como Regina Casé e Gustavo Werneck) e show de encerramento com Toni Garrido tornam a experiência rica e memorável.

Empresas de Santa Catarina que estarão presentes

  • Ramo Sistemas (Base: Joinville) – patrocínio Silver. O seu destaque será a apresentação do SAP Cloud ERP com IA nativa (Joule), incluindo adequação à reforma tributária e automações inteligentes.

  • MakeValue , também de Joinville, é patrocinadora e parceira SAP, reforçando a presença catarinense com cases voltados para a Conectividade Bancária com o SAP.

Essas empresas mostram a força do ecossistema de tecnologia de Santa Catarina, especialmente Joinville, no contexto da transformação digital nacional.

Patrocinadores do evento

Patrocinadores Diamond confirmados (ativação de grande visibilidade no evento) incluem:

  • Accenture
  • AWS
  • Deloitte
  • EY
  • Google Cloud
  • IBM
  • Microsoft
  • Mignow  

Além desses, patrocínios Silver e Gold estão previstos. Entre eles, estão a Ramo Sistemas e a MakeValue, como mencionamos.

O SAP NOW AI Tour Brazil 2025 é um marco para as empresas que desejam alavancar IA dentro de soluções SAP. A presença de patrocinadores catarinenses como Ramo e MakeValue TVM evidencia o protagonismo regional em tecnologia e inovação. Será uma excelente oportunidade para fortalecer redes, aprender com cases reais e planejar a próxima fase da transformação digital nas empresas.

Não perca a oportunidade de vivenciar o futuro da transformação digital no SAP NOW AI 2025!
Nos dias 19 e 20 de agosto, no Transamerica Expo Center em São Paulo, você poderá explorar como a Inteligência Artificial está moldando o ERP e os negócios do amanhã.

Se você é de Santa Catarina, ou busca conexões com o polo tecnológico da região, visite os estandes das empresas de Joinville, como Ramo Sistemas e MakeValue, que estarão mostrando inovações e soluções práticas com SAP Cloud ERP e IA nativa.

Garanta sua presença e venha conversar de perto com quem está liderando a transformação digital no Brasil!

 

SAP NOW

entry.title: SAP Inside Track Munich 2025 | Call for Speakers 📢 #sitMUC25
entry.content:
The SAP Inside Track Munich (#sitMUC) is back ...

Dear SAP Community,

On October 11th, the SAP community will gather once again in Garching for a day full of learning, sharing, and connecting .. and we want you to be part of it.

Whether you're deep into ABAP, building apps on SAP BTP, working with Fiori, S/4HANA, or Analytics, exploring DevOps in SAP, or shaping business processes, driving change in projects, or navigating transformation from a consulting perspective, your insights matter. Our audience comes from all corners of the SAP universe: developers, consultants, architects, product experts, and curious newcomers. That’s why we’re looking for diverse session ideas: technical deep dives, lessons learned from projects, open-source initiatives, or even side projects that others can learn from. It doesn’t have to be perfect or polished. If it’s real and relevant to the community, it belongs on stage.

Important dates and submission process:

  • Call opens: July 24st
  • Submission deadline: August 30th
  • Speaker selection: by September 5th
  • Please submit your proposal using our online form:
    sitmuc.cfapps.eu12.hana.ondemand.com

There are various session types for your submissions:

  • Short Presentation (20 min)
  • Presentation (40 min)
    you will present a topic to the audience demos, theory, live coding, or anything else that suits your expertise
  • Marketplace
    you will share your topic in a “marketplace” breakout session where everyone is welcome to walk around, visit the various stands, and interact

What we’re looking for:

  • On-site only we’ll be together in person!
  • No marketing pitches – just genuine value for the community

We’d love to hear your ideas whether you’re a seasoned speaker or presenting for the very first time. Let’s make #sitMUC25 another unforgettable community event.

If you're unsure about your topic, format, or how to present it no worries! Just drop us an email at contact@sitmuc.com, we're happy to help. Or better yet: join our next Stammtisch meetup (14.08.), and let’s chat about your session idea in person.

Let’s build this day together. Bring your voice, your story, your topic. We can’t wait to hear it!

Best regards,
sitMUC Orga team

entry.title: Quote 1.0: How to make shipping selection read-only on certain quote statuses?
entry.content:
We have a workflow status where a quote has been approved and the only available action left for the user should be to place an order. Because the Place Order action must be available, we cannot simply make the entire cart view-only. But that leaves the shipping field available for editing, which can trigger reconfiguration, potentially changing the quote when it should have been "locked in".

How can we allow the user to place an order, but prevent them from changing the shipping drop down, based on a quote status?

Thanks.

P.S. This site wouldn't let me submit the question until I selected a "board", upon which, it cleared all my fields. 😞 I don't even know what "board" I'm supposed to choose.

entry.content:
hello @AmeetJ ,

I sincerely appreciate your feedback. I will take into consideration. 

thanks

Ammar

entry.title: Re: Integration between S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and...
entry.content:
Hello @JordanoJ 

Thank you for your question regarding the integration of SAP S/4HANA public cloud with a bank using SFTP. You're correct that this process falls under Scope Item 1EG and utilises the BANKSTATEMENTPOST_IN SOAP interface.

However, the standard setup does not require converting the WSDL structure into a .txt file. Instead, banks typically send CAMT.053 or MT940 files via SFTP to SAP Integration Suite or a middleware.

The middleware then maps and transmits the content via the SOAP service into S/4HANA Cloud. Refer to the SAP documentation below

  • KBA-3374309 - Processing rules in bank statement posting - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • SAP API Business Hub – BANKSTATEMENTPOST_IN
  • Overview on Automatic Bank Statement Processing-SAP HELP

Best regards,
Chuma

entry.title: Pasar identificador unico de usuario desde app móvil a app SAPUI5 embebida
entry.content:
Hola a todos,
Quisiera pedirles ayuda a quienes hayan logrado algo similar y me puedan orientar.

Tengo un desarrollo web hecho con SAPUI5 , el cual ya está listo y embebido dentro de una aplicación móvil . El flujo es el siguiente:

  • El usuario accede primero a la aplicación móvil.

  • En ese ingreso, la aplicación móvil captura la cédula del usuario (como identificador único).

  • Luego, dentro de esa misma aplicación móvil, se carga la aplicación SAPUI5 embebida.

Lo que necesito es que, al momento de ingresar a la aplicación web, esta pueda recibir esa cédula enviada desde la aplicación móvil , para que el desarrollo haga automáticamente un filtro de datos y muestre la información correspondiente al usuario.

Agradezco mucho si alguien ha realizado este tipo de integración y puede compartirme cómo lo logró o qué debo tener en cuenta.

Saludos

entry.title: Re: Time-based revenue recognition in the public cloud
entry.content:
Hello @Naveenk_S42024 

Thank you for your question.

For time-based revenue recognition in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition using Revenue Accounting and Reporting (RAR), the relevant scope item is

Scope Item: 3IF – Revenue Accounting (Event-Based)
This scope item supports IFRS 15-compliant revenue recognition, including capabilities for time-based revenue recognition through performance obligations (POBs), contract management, and integration with Sales and Distribution (SD).

Key references to check

  • SAP Best Practices for 3IF (login required)
  • SAP Help – Event-Based Revenue Recognition

With best regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: 公司代码为阿根廷时是否可以激活Activate Payment Requisition（ID104048）
entry.content:
Hi,

The function you mentioned is tailored for Chinese Mainland customers as part of EPIC solution. Referring to 3487853 - How to use Electronic Payment Integration (EPIC) solution in countries United Kingdom, Singapore, Thailand and in Hong Kong- S/4Hana Cloud Public Edition , currently not all countries/regions can use EPIC solution.

Please explore equivalent functions in Argentina's country version or the general core finance functions. If you find your request not able to be fulfilled, please submit a request in SAP Customer Influence Portal or contact your SAP customer-facing colleagues in case of a go-live critical situation.

Best Regards,
Fancy

entry.title: Re: Best Practices for Onboarding and MiniEC – With a Focus on Offboarding and Crossboarding
entry.content:
Is there any more standard SAP guidance on using BIB Replication for Onboardees to replicate to S/4? If S/4 (SAP ERP as the HCM system) does the hiring HCM actions, and then using the same replication of S/4 to Employee Central after they're hired; per the same steps you're referring too but with specifics involving EC Minimaster? All guidance on BIB replication focus on if you using full blown Employee Central with BIB Replication because EC is the source. There doesn't seem to be consistent materials on ONB 2.0 upgrade utilizing EC mini and also using S/4 (ERP/SAP) as your HRIS system still. 

Reference from the blog with some notes in red:

"Employee Data Replication

Employee Data replication, as per Best Practice, must be implemented using Business Integration Builder (BIB). BIB framework includes configuration layer, reports for triggering Organizational and Employees Data replication on backend side, it takes advantage of prepackaged Integration Flows on BTP Integration Suite and of the SuccessFactors oData API to upsert data into Employee Central entities (that means Crossboarding and Offboarding processes can be triggered from every external tool using SuccessFactors oData APIs for updating employees data). As of the last note we saw crossboarding and offboarding is not supported in EC mini. 

BIB configuration documentation for replicating Employee and Organizational Data from SAP ERP HCM to Employee Central can be found at following link: Introduction to Employee Data Replication to Employee Central"

No clear documentation on both sending data from ONB/EC to ERP, processing actions in SAP S/4, and then sending back to EC mini after hiring is finished in S/4 regarding using BIB replication in both ways in this scenario. Most documentation simply states "build a custom integration". Yours is the first to really point out leveraging BIB but a bit unclear on best practices for both ways.

Thanks

Can you reproduce this issue and if so, have you tried a more recent release? The version you are running was released in 2017. it is possible that there are fixes that may be relevant.

entry.title: Re: The set of views could not be read from the database.
entry.content: You need to ensure that the procedure sa_materialized_view_can_be_immediate has execute permissions for public or the specific limited user encountering this message.

entry.title: Re: Time-based revenue recognition in the public cloud
entry.content:
Hi Naveen,

For time-based revenue recognition:-

3KK: Contract-Based Revenue Recognition - Professional Services (This is a key one for service contracts and projects)
3VS: Contract-Based Revenue Recognition - Subscription Billing (If you're using SAP Subscription Billing for your packages)

It's important to note that with recent releases (starting with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2408), SAP has introduced Universal Revenue Recognition (URR). URR aims to combine the capabilities of both Event-Based Revenue Recognition (EBRR) and Contract-Based Revenue Recognition (CBRR) into a unified framework. If you choose to implement URR, you would still consider 3KK and 3VS as relevant for the CBRR aspects, in addition to any EBRR scope items for your specific integration scenarios.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Change Material serialization profile on Production Order creation
entry.content:
Hello, we are looking to change a material's serialization profile (from auto->manual and manual->auto) depending on Production Order type. This needs to be done during Production Order creation.

entry.title: Re: External tax procedure - Vertex interface setup issue...
entry.content:
Hi @Govind_Sharma ,

Below is my inline response

1. This message usually appears when you're trying to activate or transport configuration changes and the system is checking for lock status or dependencies in the target systems - like Q or P.
Certain configuration activities are currently locked in the target system - like Q or P. You need to unlock or release those locks before you can proceed with the change or transport.

2. It is highly complex and generally not recommended to change the tax procedure for company codes that already have financial postings. which are "LIVE"

3. If your business requirement explicitly states the need for Vertex for Canada, it implies a scenario that goes beyond the standard 4Q2 scope for Canada. You would need to engage with SAP directly (via incident or consulting) to discuss the feasibility and the required approach for integrating Vertex for Canadian tax calculation in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. They would advise if a standard solution is becoming available, or if a specific extensibility project is needed.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Bex query cannot distinguish between key and text in new line
entry.content:
hello

Bex query cannot distinguish between key and text in new line..

 

The first case.
We use an info object "A". For example, aaa as the key value for it, and the text of aaa is "apple".

In the related query, A is displayed as text, so the user will type it as "apple" in the new line.

However, since the key value of apple exists in A's master table (key: apple, text: application),

the value is entered as an "application".

The second case.
we use an info object "B". This is also displayed as  text in the query.

For this, C is a compound. The value of C is ccc. (constant value. So of course, it's in fixed filter)
There is bbb as the value of B info object. The text is "banana".
However, if you type "banana" in the new line, a warning occurs that the compound  value has not been entered.

Why can't bex query distinguish between key and text input?

entry.title: Re: SAPFPAYM not triggered automatically after F110 / Man...
entry.content:
Hi @SADIK99 ,

Try below steps and let me know if it worked.

-Go to OBPM4 (Create/Assign Selection Variants).
-Select your Payment Medium Format (FI_PAYMEDIUM_DMEE_CGI_05).
-Create a variant for program SAPFPAYM (if not already existing for this format).
-Ensure the "Data Medium Exchange" checkbox is selected in the variant's output control.
-Specify the desired logical file name that links to your AL11 path.
-Assign this SAPFPAYM variant to the specific combination of your Company Code, House Bank, and Account ID that you are using in your F110 payment run.
-Do a test run F110 again in your test environment. The DME file should now be generated automatically and appear in AL11.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: KEA5_How to define a new character(WWXXX) with option...
entry.content:
Hello @Cjjchujunchen ,

When you try to create a custom characteristic (e.g., WWABC1) in KEA5, SAP asks you to choose the origin of the characteristic. If you choose origin type "1 – User-defined characteristic", then it’s a user-defined characteristic, the table and field entries are locked/grayed out
This is standard SAP behavior — you cannot manually select a field/table for user-defined characteristics.

If you choose Origin = 2 – Table field, then, you’ll be able to select - A table name (e.g., KNA1, VBRK, etc.) - A field name from that table (e.g., LAND1, SPART, etc.)
Please note only transparent tables are allowed (not structures or pooled/clustered tables)

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: Overall Status Description Customization in Test Suit...
entry.content:
Test status description is maintained in the following data elements for respective colors.

SMT_V_TPLN_CNT_GREEN

SMT_V_TPLN_CNT_YELLOW

SMT_V_TPLN_CNT_RED

SMT_V_TPLN_CNT_BLUE

 

Choose any one of the following solutions best suited to your business requirement.

 

1.Update the standard data element label

Tcode CMOD->GOTO->Text Enhancements-> Keyword->Change.

Enter Data element and add custom label.

Note: This impacts all the reports.

During upgrade this has to be manually changed else the original settings will be updated.

 

2. Enhance Method CL_SMT_CUST_UTIL=>GET_TEXT_4_TCSE_STATUS_COLOR_1 - this will impact multiple places.

3. Enhance method CL_SMT_RPT_TPLN_REPORTING=>BUILD_TPLN_TPCK_TCSE_HIER, field name status_color_txt in itab ET_TPLN_STATUS_INTREE. -this will be called in tpln report also in tpck report.( Note : This is preferred solution as this does not impact other areas)

entry.title: Re: Use of statistical projects
entry.content:
Hello @FranciscoCosta ,

A statistical project is used for reporting and analysis only. It does not carry actual costs — instead, all real financial impact is assigned to a real cost object (like a cost center). The statistical project acts as an additional dimension for internal tracking.

-No real impact on financial statements
-Requires a real cost object in parallel for every posting
-Used for internal cost tracking, time recording, or reporting
-Not suitable for billing, budgeting, or settlement

Best Practice Use Cases
-Internal Time Tracking: For non-billable work like R&D or training
-Overhead Cost Breakdown: Granular cost tracking under large cost centers
-Cross-Department Initiatives: Unified reporting for programs like “Sustainability”
-Marketing Campaigns: Track campaign costs without revenue posting

You can post:

-Supplier invoices
-Manual journal entries
-Internal activity allocations
-Timesheets
-Purchase requisitions/orders
-Goods receipts

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: IK18 - mass deactivate multiple measurement documents
entry.content:
Hi,

SAP do not provide mass deletion for measurement document. You have only option is run SARA,- archive and delete for PM_MDOC object.

This is log data and sometimes legal data. There is nothing called deactivation for the log. It can be just deleted.

Regards,

entry.title: Re: KEA5_How to define a new character(WWXXX) with option...
entry.content: For origin 1 (user-defined) characteristics, SAP does not allow table/field entries in KEA5. A developer may have enhanced KEA5 or used a BAdI or exit to inject table/field data. In rare case modified configuration table via direct table manipulation/update. I hope this answers your question.

entry.title: Re: Trading Partner within MM Subcontracting Consumption...
entry.content:
In that case,

  1. consider leveraging SAP’s Asset Maintenance Subcontracting process. Create a Maintenance Order for the broken item. Assign the material serial number and set the Refurbishment indicator. Add a subcontracting operation to the order.
  2. System creates a Purchase Requisition with Item category L (subcontracting) referencing to the broken item’s serial number.
  3. Convert PR to PO for the repair service. No BOM needed—this avoids automatic 543 posting. Send the broken item via outbound delivery, tracked as subcontracting stock.
  4. GR for the repaired item posts only the service value. No component consumption or trading partner assignment. You retain ownership of the broken item throughout.

This process is described in detail in SAP's  Help documentation

entry.title: Re: Error during SBO user authentication DI API
entry.content:
Hi @SujaSuja ,

The error message indicates that one of the connection parameters is supplied incorrectly.

Can you make sure that the User Name and Passwords are entered correctly? Also, as you are using SAP HANA, make sure that you follow the case-sensitivity.

Also, confirm if you are using Single-Sign On (SSO) or not? If yes, you cannot use normal SAP Business One User and Password for login. You will have to login using Windows Domain User Name and Password.

Kind regards,

ANKIT CHAUHAN

SAP Business One Support

entry.title: Re: Seeking Guidance on Growing
entry.content:
Apart from the suggestion already given,  to become a successful Data Analyst, some of the below approaches are recommended

  • Shadow Functional Consultants and learn how data supports business processes. Get familiar with core modules like FI, MM, SD. Understand how master and transactional data flows across modules.
  • LSMW (Legacy System Migration Workbench) which is still widely used in ECC environments.
  • SAP S/4HANA Migration Cockpit (LTMC) which is essential for S/4HANA projects.
  • BODS (SAP Data Services) which is a powerful ETL tool for complex migrations.
  • IDocs & BAPIs for programmatic data transfer and integration.
  • Exposure to ABAP basics helps when customizing migration logic
  • Learn how to customize migration objects modeler (LTMOM) in S/4HANA
  • Finally and most importantly, Join SAP Community & LinkedIn Groups and stay updated and network with peers.

entry.title: SAP Build Process Automationで「グループ宛て承認ワークフロー」を構築する
entry.content:
はじめに

SAP Build Process Automation（SBPA）は、ノーコードで業務プロセスを素早く自動化できる強力なツールです。
本記事では、SAP Cloud Identity Services – Identity Authentication (以下、SAP IAS)で定義したユーザーグループを宛先として、複数のユーザーに対して承認依頼を送るプロセスの構築手順を、画面キャプチャとともに紹介します。

ステップ①：SAP IASでユーザーグループを作成・設定する

まず、承認先となるユーザーグループをSAP IASの管理画面から作成します。

1. グループの作成

SAP IAS管理画面で「Create Group」から新しいグループを作成します。

  • Name / Display Name：Demo_Managers
  • Description：マネージャー用のユーザーグループ

2. アプリケーションとの関連付け

このグループをSAP Build Process Automationに紐づけます。

  • Application：SAP Build Process Automation
  • Group Type：userGroup
  • Supported Operations：readWrite

3. 内容を確認し、「Finish」で確定

 

ステップ②：グループにユーザーをアサインする

承認を担当するユーザーをグループに追加します。ここでは、マネージャーAとマネージャーBをアサインしています。

これで、SAP Build Process Automationからこのグループを指定して承認依頼を送る準備が整いました。

ステップ③：申請フォーム（startForm）を作成する

次に、申請者が入力するフォームをSAP Build Process Automationで作成します。

フォーム構成：

  • 送付先グループ（ドロップダウン）
    • 値：Demo_Managers / Demo_Finance / Demo_HR（今回は手動定義とします）
    • 必須：ON
  • 備考（テキストエリア）

テストの目的で、申請者がどのグループに依頼を出すかを選べる構成とします。

ステップ④：承認フォーム（ApprovalForm）を作成する

承認者が内容を確認し、処理するための画面を作成します。

  • 備考欄を表示（読み取り専用）
  • 「承認」「却下」ボタン

ステップ⑤：ワークフローを構築する

フォームが完成したら、ワークフロー全体を組み立てます。

プロセス構成：

  1. Trigger（startForm）
  2. Approvalステップ（ApprovalForm）
  3. 承認/却下の分岐
  4. End

承認ステップの設定：

  • Approval Form：ApprovalForm
  • Recipients > Groups：startFormの「送付先グループ」の値をバインド

ステップ⑥：実行と挙動の確認

1. 申請画面（申請者がグループを選択して送信）

2. 承認者A/BのInboxにタスクが届く

マネージャーAのInbox画面

マネージャーBのInbox画面

申請はグループ全員に配信され、誰か1人が対応すれば完了です。

ちなみに、画面右下にある「Claim」ボタンを使えば、タスクを「自分が担当します」と宣言できます。Claimされたタスクは他のメンバーのInboxから非表示になり、二重対応の防止や担当の明確化に役立ちます。

承認者Bにより「Claim」されると、他の承認者のInboxからは承認タスクが見えなくなります。

まとめ

SAP Build Process AutomationとSAP IASを連携することで、ユーザーグループ単位での柔軟な承認フローをノーコードで構築できます。
以下の流れでステップバイステップに対応可能です：

  1. SAP IASでグループを作成し、ユーザーをアサイン
  2. SAP Build Process Automationで申請フォームと承認フォームを作成
  3. グループに対してしたワークフローを構築
  4. グループに属する誰かが処理できる

業務チームや部門単位での柔軟な承認プロセス設計に、ぜひご活用ください。

entry.title: SAP Cloud ALM Integration Monitoring - Anomalies in number of message processed
entry.content:
The managed service is responsible for processing messages in the customer's landscape. Any significant deviation—either an increase or decrease—in the volume of processed messages may impact their business operations. Therefore, they require timely notifications of such anomalies.

Introducing the new "Anomalies detected" event in SAP Cloud ALM's Integration & Exception Monitoring app allows customers to configure such events. This latest event is available for all monitored services and systems.

This blog describes some customer needs and how the Anomaly event needs to be configured.

Customer use cases

1. I want to be notified when my SAP Integration Suite(Cloud Integration) tenant doesn't process any message in the last hour

To fulfil this need, we will need to perform the following configuration.

In the Parameter section:

  •  Set "Calculation frequency in minutes" to 60 minutes.
  • Set "Condition" to Lower Threshold
  • Set "Critical for Lower Threshold" to 0

In the Filter section:

  • No filters are needed

In the Event Action section:

  • Enable the email notification option and add the recipient emails.

2. I want to be notified when my SAP Integration Suite(Cloud Integration) tenant doesn't process any message for a specific IFlow in the last hour

In the Parameter section:

  •  Set "Calculation frequency in minutes" to 60 minutes.
  • Set "Condition" to Lower Threshold
  • Set "Critical for Lower Threshold" to 0

In the Filter section:

  • Integration Flow Name: The desired Integration Flow

In the Event Action section:

  • Enable the email notification option and add the recipient emails.

3. I want to be notified when my SAP Integration Suite(Cloud Integration) tenant processes more than 10000 failed messages in a day

In the Parameter section:

  •  Set "Calculation frequency in minutes" to 1440(24 hours) minutes.
  • Set "Condition" to Upper Threshold
  • Set "Critical for Upper Threshold" to 10000

In the Filter section:

  • Status: Failed

In the Event Action section:

  • Enable the email notification option and add the recipient emails.

4. I want to be notified every day at 21:00 hours if my SAP Integration Suite(Cloud Integration) tenant is not processing between 100 and 10000 messages in a day

If you would like the calculation to start at a fixed time to have control over when you would like to be notified, then you can use the Calculation start time option

In the Parameter section:

  • Set "Calculation start time" to 21:00
  • Set "Calculation frequency in minutes" to 1440(24 hours) minutes.
  • Set "Condition" to Upper and Lower Threshold
  • Set "Critical for Upper Threshold" to 10000
  • Set "Critical for Lower Threshold" to 10000

In the Filter section:

  • No filters are needed

In the Event Action section:

  • Enable the email notification option and add the recipient emails.

Example Alert in Alert Inbox

Alert Details

Example of Email notification

If you want more information on configuring these settings, refer to Anomalies Detected in Message Processing Event. 

If you are interested in other event types in Integration and Exception Monitoring, refer to the blogs below

Create Events Based on Message Processing Time in Integration and Exception Monitoring

Monitoring Integration Issues with the New “Issues Detected” Event in SAP Cloud ALM

entry.title: Re: Handling CSV Data Deployment in CAP HDI Without Data Loss
entry.content:
Automated Data Cleanup Using SAP HANA Migration Tables:

SAP HANA provides a robust feature called Migration Tables (.hdbmigrationtable) that enables seamless and automated data cleanup. For more details with a real-world example, refer to HANA Database Migration: Handling Incompatible Changes to Existing Tables 

I mentioned in this blog that implementing automated cleanup requires developing custom tasks to remove obsolete data. However, with migration tables, you can simplify this process significantly, no changes to your current system behaviour are needed!

Deployment 1: Initial Setup

  1. Create /src/OPPC.UOM.hdbmigrationtable
    This file is generated during the CDS build step when you annotate your entity with @CDS.persistence.journal. This instructs CAP to create a migration table, enabling versioning and data migrations.
    Example:
    == version=1

COLUMN TABLE OPPC_UOM (
  CODE NVARCHAR(5) NOT NULL,
  LANGUAGE_CODE NVARCHAR(2) NOT NULL,
  COMMERCIAL_DESCRIPTION NVARCHAR(3),
  LONG_DESCRIPTION NVARCHAR(30),
  ORIGIN NVARCHAR(2),
  PRIMARY KEY(CODE, LANGUAGE_CODE)
) WITH ASSOCIATIONS (
  MANY TO ONE JOIN OPPC_ISOCodeMapping AS isoCodeMapping ON (isoCodeMapping.CODE = CODE)
)
    The structure is similar to /src/gen/OPPC.UOM.hdbtable, but includes the migration version header.
  2. Add /src/gen/OPPC.UOM.hdbtable to undeploy.json
    This step removes the static table definition from the HDI container, preventing conflicts with the migration table.
  3. Set HDI_DEPLOY_OPTIONS for Controlled Undeployment
    Configure HDI_DEPLOY_OPTIONS to undeploy /src/gen/OPPC-UOM.hdbtabledata without deleting data in the OPPC_UOM table. This preserves existing data during artifact changes.
  4. Deploy and InitDB
    Deploy the changes and perform the InitDB operation.

Deployment 2: Data Migration and Filtering

  1. Remove HDI_DEPLOY_OPTIONS
    After the initial migration, remove the custom deploy options to restore standard deployment behavior.
  2. Update /src/OPPC.UOM.hdbmigrationtable for Data Migration
    Increment the migration version and add a migration block to delete entries where ORIGIN = '02'. This is important if you plan to use an include_filter in your table data, as existing data may conflict with new constraints.
    Example:
    == version=2

COLUMN TABLE OPPC_UOM (
  CODE NVARCHAR(5) NOT NULL,
  LANGUAGE_CODE NVARCHAR(2) NOT NULL,
  COMMERCIAL_DESCRIPTION NVARCHAR(3),
  LONG_DESCRIPTION NVARCHAR(30),
  ORIGIN NVARCHAR(2),
  PRIMARY KEY(CODE, LANGUAGE_CODE)
) WITH ASSOCIATIONS (
  MANY TO ONE JOIN OPPC_ISOCodeMapping AS isoCodeMapping ON (isoCodeMapping.CODE = CODE)
)

== migration = 2
DELETE FROM "OPPC_UOM" WHERE "ORIGIN" = '02';
  3. Add /src/gen/OPPC.UOM.hdbtable and /src/csv/OPPC-UOM.csv to undeploy.json
    This ensures obsolete artifacts and data files are removed from the HDI container.
  4. Move Data Files to a Static Folder
    Relocate OPPC-UOM.hdbtabledata and OPPC-UOM.csv to a dedicated static folder (e.g., src/static/csv). This prevents CDS from auto-generating a .hdbtabledata file for OPPC-UOM.csv since you need to customise OPPC-UOM.hdbtabledata with an include_filter.
  5. Modify OPPC-UOM.hdbtabledata to Filter Data
    Update the file to only include records where ORIGIN = '02', ensuring only relevant data is loaded.
  6. Deploy and InitDB
    Deploy the changes and perform the InitDB operation.

entry.title: Re: Enhancement for COR6N

entry.title: Driving Variance Colors in SAC Based on Calculated Measures in Numeric Point Charts Using Thresholds
entry.content:
Driving Custom Variance Colors in SAP SAC Based on Calculated Measures in Numeric Point Charts

SAP Analytics Cloud's chart variance functionality enables users to visualize differences between measure versions or temporal data points, supporting calculations between any two measures regardless of their inclusion in the primary visualization. Organizations can configure these variances to incorporate version-based, time-based, or standalone comparisons according to their analytical requirements.

The platform's dynamic variance capabilities provide contextual responsiveness, automatically recalculating variance metrics when underlying measures within the visualization are modified. This ensures that variance displays remain current and accurate as users navigate through different analytical perspectives, enhancing the overall analytical workflow and decision-making process.

In this post, we'll review how to drive Custom Variance Colors in SAP SAC based on Calculated Measures in numeric point charts, enabling clearer comparisons between two versions at any point in time. This approach enhances custom visualization aesthetics and improves data interpretation through strategic color coding aligned with business thresholds and performance indicators.

1. Insert a Chart and Choose Visualization Type

Add a chart to your story and set its type to Numeric Point.

2. Select the Primary Account

Choose your desired account—this can be a parent or a leaf account.

3. Add Restricted Measures

Go to:
Add Measure → Add Calculation → Restricted Measure

Create two restricted measures based on version and date:

  • Actuals 2025

  • Budget 2025

4. Create Variance Measures

Define two calculated measures to compare values:

  • Actuals vs. Budget: Actuals 2025 - Budget 2025

  • Budget vs. Actuals: Budget 2025 - Actuals 2025

5. Set Up Thresholds

  • Add a Threshold

  • Create two rules by filtering on the calculated measures:

    • One where positive values are green and negative are red

    • One where positive values are red and negative are green

 

6. Enable Thresholds via Trellis

Clicking Show Threshold may not work immediately — the “Story Defined” option could be greyed out as shown below.

To fix this:

  • Go to the Chart Add-On panel

  • Add a Trellis, selecting measures

 

Once the Trellis is added, the threshold option becomes available.
Select your threshold, and you’ll now be able to drive variance colors based on the calculated measure filters set up in the background.

Conclusion:

By leveraging calculated measures and trellis-based thresholds, SAP SAC users can dynamically drive custom variance colors in numeric point charts. This empowers more intuitive and immediate visual insights into performance deviations. The result is a more engaging and effective analytical experience aligned with organizational KPIs.

entry.title: Getting Started with Joule Studio in SAP Build – Part 4: Managing Access to Custom Joule Skills
entry.content:
Disclaimer: The insights shared in this blog are based on my personal observations and learning. They may not apply universally, and I encourage readers to conduct their own research and make an informed decision before using this content for productive use.

In the previous part of this series, we demonstrated how to build and deploy custom Joule Skills and integrate them into SAP Build Work Zone sites. However, a critical aspect of deploying these skills in a real-world environment is access control deciding who can use your custom skills and how to share them securely.

By default, only users who are explicitly granted Execute or Admin access in the shared environment can consume your deployed Joule Skills. If other users attempt to interact with the skill, they receive a generic fallback response from Joule, which doesn't reflect the actual skill functionality.

 

Let’s walk through how to share your Joule Skills securely and effectively using SAP Build and SAP Cloud Identity Services.

Understanding the Access Control Behaviour

SAP Build's environment sharing works as follows:

  • You can share a project with up to 10 user groups or 5 individual users.
  • You cannot mix individual users and groups; if you do, only groups will be considered.
  • The access types available are:
    • Execute – Allows users to use the deployed skill
    • Admin – Full access to manage the environment

Option 1: Open Access for Everyone

If your use case allows, you can make the skill available to all users within your organization:

  • Go to the shared environment in SAP Build.
  • Click on Share → Set General Access to Everyone with access: Execute.

 

This method makes the skill available to all users with access to the environment. Use with caution if the skill exposes sensitive operations or data.

Option 2: Controlled Access Using User Groups

For better governance and security, use user groups from your Cloud Identity Services (CIS) tenant:

  • Create a User Group in your IAS (Cloud Identity) tenant.

 

  • Assign the required users to this group (those who should have access to the skill).

 

  • In SAP Build, open the shared environment of your custom Joule Skill.

 

  • Click Share, set Type to User Group, and enter the exact name of the group you created in IAS.
  • Set the appropriate authorization (Execute or Admin).

 

Refresh & Redeploy Access

Once you’ve shared with user groups:

  • Navigate to the Joule tab inside the environment.
  • Click Refresh.

 

  • You’ll see a message: “Please redeploy the capability to refresh their access right.”
  • Click on “Click here to redeploy” to apply the new access configuration.

 

It may take a few minutes for the redeployment to complete. Use Refresh to monitor the status.

 

Final Verification

After successful redeployment:

  • The Launch button will become active again.

 

  • Users assigned to the user group can now consume the Joule Skill from the Work Zone site.
  • If any user still doesn’t see the expected response, try:
    • Clearing browser cookies
    • Using incognito/private mode for a fresh session

 

When users click Open from the response message, they will be directed to the associated application screen (if configured).

 

Conclusion

Access management is a vital step in rolling out custom Joule Skills at scale. Whether you want to expose your skill to all users or control access via user groups, SAP Build offers the flexibility to do both. Properly sharing and redeploying your skill ensures the right people get the right experience and keeps your environment secure and manageable.
